programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: The story of a giant otter cub rescued and raised by Brazilian naturalist Carolina Vargas. The creature has to be bottle fed, learn how to hunt fish and be taught how to survive the predators of the worlds largest wetland, the Pantanal in South America

programme.title: The Yorkshire Dales
programme.desc: Adventurer and explorer Paul Rose heads for Wensleydale as he sets out to explore the region, starting in the small town of Hawes, where locals now run many of their own services, including the buses. Paul checks out why cycling is so popular in the Dales and tries to get to the top of the Buttertubs Pass. Along the way he meets a family of dormice and spends time with a man who looks after one of the areas most imposing castles

programme.title: The Cult of Sunday Night
programme.desc: A look at appeal of the BBCs rural drama, which could be said to have set the template for Sunday night programming with its mix of nostalgia, romance, eccentric characters and stunning scenery. Cast and crew reveal things were often much less cosy behind the scenes, thanks to accidents, cantankerous actors and the limited supply of source material

programme.title: Christopher Timothy and Peter Davison Remember - All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: Actors Christopher Timothy and Peter Davison share their memories of the popular BBC drama series, revealing what it was like to meet the real James Herriot. They also speak about the work they did trailing real vets to make the scenes more credible and the joy they got from performing alongside an array of talented character actors

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: Siegfried gives another lecture on economy to Calum, who is visited by Molly McFeely, with whose family he stayed while in Ireland - while Deirdre also pays a call at the same time. Meanwhile, James receives an invitation to examine Lord Buttermeres new stallion. Rural drama, starring John McGlynn, Robert Hardy and Christopher Timothy. First broadcast in 1988

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: Calum cooks a meal, but it takes so long to prepare his guests drink too much and pass out before it is ready. Meanwhile, James encounters a dog that faints to gain attention. Rural drama, starring Robert Hardy, Christopher Timothy and John McGlynn. First broadcast in 1988

programme.title: Evil Does Not Exist
programme.desc: A man and his daughter fight back when a real estate developer threatens to build a camping site near their home. Japanese drama, starring Hitoshi Omika

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Barbara is persuaded to speak to a womens group about her self-sufficient lifestyle - and soon finds herself in great demand. Vintage comedy, with Richard Briers and Felicity Kendal, featuring guest appearances by Robert Lindsay and Angela Thorne

programme.title: Yes Minister
programme.desc: Sir Humphrey is horrified when Jim decides to support the sale of an art gallery to save the football club in his constituency from going under. Comedy, starring Paul Eddington and Nigel Hawthorne

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small

Paul checks out why cycling is so popular in the Dales and tries to get to the top of the Buttertubs Pass. Along the way he meets a family of dormice and spends time with a man who looks after one of the areas most imposing castles

programme.title: The Cult of Sunday Night
programme.desc: A look at appeal of the BBCs rural drama, which could be said to have set the template for Sunday night programming with its mix of nostalgia, romance, eccentric characters and stunning scenery. Cast and crew reveal things were often much less cosy behind the scenes, thanks to accidents, cantankerous actors and the limited supply of source material

programme.title: Walking with
programme.desc: The comedian better known to some as Vic Reeves explores a fascinating corner of the Kent coast as he walks down to Dungeness. Along the way he meets locals, explores military ruins and rides a steam train

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels to South America, home to more than 50,000 endemic plant species. Beginning in Brazil, the intrepid horticulturist views the private oasis of artist Burle Marx, and takes a trip by boat to the unique floating gardens of the Amazon, before visiting the coast of Chile - where an agriculturalist has created a landscape in tune with its craggy locale

programme.title: Oak Tree: Natures Greatest Survivor
programme.desc: George McGavin explores one of the great icons of the British countryside - the oak tree. Studying a 400-year-old tree throughout the different seasons of the year, George investigates its surprisingly sophisticated biology, how it adapts to its ever-changing environment and why it has become such an important part of the countryside

programme.title: Banned! The Mary Whitehouse Story
programme.desc: Part one of two. Looking back at the life of Mary Whitehouse, the teacher and housewife who ran a 30-year campaign to turn back the tide the permissive culture she saw sweeping through society with the advent of the sexual revolution. The programme revisits some of her campaigns, including boycotts against films like Last Tango In Paris, and features first-hand testimony from the people who knew her and studied her work

programme.title: Banned! The Mary Whitehouse Story
programme.desc: Part two of two. In the 1970s, Marys battle with permissive society heats up as ideas of progress and suggestions that nothing should be censored gain currency, and intent on being the nations moral guardian, she takes her battles to the courts. Later, the programme looks back at Marys final campaigning phase, where she gets closer to the seat of power than anyone thought possible with her relationship with Mrs Thatcher

programme.title: Genius of the Ancient World
programme.desc: Bettany Hughes series exploring the lives and teachings of influential ancient philosophers draws to a close with a profile of Confucius, who is credited as the first Chinese thinker to take a systematic philosophical approach to issues of social, political and ethical importance. Born during the chaotic Spring and Autumn period of Chinese history, Confucius believed that harmony could be promoted and achieved through the examples of sage rulers. He was also a innovative teacher, and tried to instill his principles of moral excellence in Chinas elite, but died without seeing his vision for his nation come to pass. However, his philosophies would eventually form the bedrock of Chinese culture, with many of his principles of tradition surviving to this day

programme.title: The Story of Welsh Art
programme.desc: Huw Stephens reveals how, as the 20th century dawned, artists found radical new ways to depict Wales, pushing themselves to extremes and redefining what art could be. His venture takes him to the National Museum Wales in Cardiff, Bardsey Island off the Llyn Peninsula, Colwyn Bay and Swansea

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels to South America, home to more than 50,000 endemic plant species. Beginning in Brazil, the intrepid horticulturist views the private oasis of artist Burle Marx, and takes a trip by boat to the unique floating gardens of the Amazon, before visiting the coast of Chile - where an agriculturalist has created a landscape in tune with its craggy locale

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by chefs Philip Khoury and Rukmini Iyer, plus special guest Richard Osman. Helen McGinn is pairing the wines, and James and Thom Elliot make pizza

programme.title: Rick Steins Cornwall
programme.desc: The chef glimpses life in Cornwall 2,000 years ago as he explores the atmospheric ruins of the ancient village of Carn Euny. Rick also cooks his favourite Sunday lunch, a hearty steak and kidney pudding, and goes for a bracing ride on a beautiful hand-built boat

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Alex Scott and guests look ahead to the weekends matches, including Newcastle United v Arsenal. Plus, news from the lunchtime game between Brentford and Manchester United

programme.title: Missing Link
programme.desc: Fearless explorer Sir Lionel Frost is approached by fur-covered, eight-foot-tall creature Mr Link who, tired of living a solitary existence in the Pacific Northwest, wants to find his long-lost relatives in the fabled valley of Shangri-La. Animated comedy, with the voices of Hugh Jackman, Zach Galifianakis, Zoe Saldana, David Walliams and Stephen Fry

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph rescues a kitchen cabinet from the tip for audio engineer Mark Phillips to turn into a Bluetooth speaker

programme.title: Live Womens Rugby World Cup 2025
programme.sub-title: Womens Rugby World Cup Final 2025: Canada v England
programme.desc: Canada v England (Kick-off 4.00pm). Coverage of the final, which comes from Allianz Stadium Twickenham in London. New Zealand edged a thrilling contest 34-31 against England in the last final three years ago in Auckland, but with the Red Roses now the team holding home advantage, and showing good form against France in the semi-finals, they will be hopeful of going one better this time around. However, they face a tough test against the Canadians, who won 34-19 against the holders in the last four

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing
programme.desc: Tess Daly and Claudia Winkleman present the first live edition as the ballroom dance show returns. The celebrities and their partners perform their opening routines, safe in the knowledge that no one is being voted off this week, although judges Shirley Ballas, Craig Revel Horwood, Motsi Mabuse and Anton Du Beke will offer their comments - good or bad. The audience are bound to be cheering on actress and Love Island star Amber Davies, who has been drafted in at the last minute to replace the injured Dani Dyer, while the rest of the celebrities are Alex Kingston, Balvinder Sopal, Stefan Dennis, Lewis Cope, Vicky Pattison, Harry Aikines-Aryeetey, Jimmy Floyd Hasselbaink, Karen Carney, Chris Robshaw, Ellie Goldstein, Ross King, La Voix, Thomas Skinner and George Clarke

programme.title: Nine Bodies in a Mexican Morgue
programme.desc: Nine people survive a plane crash in the Mexican jungle, but they dont know that a murderer lurks in their midst. Nine days later, bodies are recovered by the army, but one passenger is missing. Mystery, starring Eric McCormack

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Crystal Palace v Liverpool at Selhurst Park and Manchester City v Burnley at Etihad Stadium. The Eagles and Liverpool had already met once this term in the Community Shield, with Palace prevailing on penalties after a 2-2 draw. The Clarets faced a tough test away to the Citizens, who beat them 3-1 here when the sides last met two seasons ago. Plus, Brentford v Manchester United, Chelsea v Brighton and Hove Albion, Leeds United v Bournemouth, Nottingham Forest v Sunderland and Tottenham Hotspur v Wolverhampton Wanderers

programme.title: The Football Interview
programme.desc: Kelly Somers talks to Bournemouth manager Andoni Iraola, who joined the club in 2023 having previously been at the helm of Rayo Vallecano in his native Spain

programme.title: Scary Stories to Tell in the Dark
programme.desc: The shadow of the Bellows family has loomed large in the small town of Mill Valley for generations, and young Sarah Bellows turns her tortured life and horrible secrets into a series of scary stories. These terrifying tales soon have a way of becoming all too real for a group of unsuspecting teens, who stumble upon Sarahs spooky home. Horror, starring Zoe Margaret Colletti and Michael Garza

programme.desc: Angela Barnes presents an appeal on behalf of Sarcoma UK, a rare cancer charity that provides support services for people, funds research for new treatments and gives critical help to anyone diagnosed with sarcoma and their families

programme.desc: Sarah Moore gives an old tartan picnic rug to bag-maker Rosanna Gethin and a set of tired chairs to upcycler Rachel Henderson, while she restyles a vintage glass display cabinet

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: In Ellesmere Port, James wants to turn his neglected garden into a Cornish coastal haven, providing a safe space for his dog and visiting family. Enter Charlie Dimmock and Lee Burkhill with competing designs. Which one will James decide to go with?

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Denise Nurse helps a couple to find a new home closer to their son in Northumberland, and also pays a visit to the Northumberland National Park

programme.title: Attenborough and the Giant Sea Monster
programme.desc: The veteran naturalist investigates the discovery of a lifetime - the skull of a pliosaur, one of the most ferocious Jurassic predators ever known. This prehistoric marine reptile ruled the seas 150 million years ago, at the same time dinosaurs reigned on land. It measured up at an incredible 12 metres long and boasted phenomenal strength. David has been an avid fossil collector since he was a boy, but he has never come across a find quite like this. He follows two of the UKs most intrepid fossil hunters on their perilous expedition to excavate the skull from its resting place 12 metres up in a cliff face

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Charlotte Smith are in Wrexham for the biggest date in the sheepdog trialling calendar - the Supreme. Set against the beautiful backdrop of Brynkinalt Estate, the finest dogs and handlers from across the UK and Ireland go head-to-head, showing off their skill, instinct and teamwork. After months of training and a year of tough qualifying trials, it all comes down to this - only one can walk away as Supreme Champion

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: The Roadshow visits Lister Park and Cartwright Hall in Bradford, where treasures include a jewel-encrusted gold bunny brooch, a portrait of a dog and an ancient stone head. Joanna Hardy challenges Fiona Bruce to Basic, Better, Best with three exquisite items of Art Deco jewellery, ranging in price from £20,000 to a staggering £100,000. Meanwhile, Richard Price is thrilled to see a 1970s Patek Philippe watch made from glistening tigers eye gemstones and diamonds, which was given as a wedding present to the owner

programme.title: Freddie Flintoffs Field of Dreams
programme.sub-title: Freddie Flintoffs Field of Dreams: Ultimate Test
programme.desc: Freddie expands his roster of coaches to help with the growing responsibility of managing his new cricket teams, but a training session does not go as planned. To help attract the next generation of young players to their club, some reluctant girls are roped in to deliver a cricket training session at a local primary school, with surprising and heartwarming results

programme.title: King and Conqueror
programme.desc: Sacrifices have to be made when Harold strikes against a Viking invader and William seeks a fleet. Edith fears for the future, while Matilda moves to secure hers

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Highlights of the latest Premier League matches, featuring Newcastle United v Arsenal at St James Park and Aston Villa v Fulham at Villa Park. Newcastle won three of the four meetings between them and the Gunners in all competitions last term, including a 1-0 victory here in the league. Villa defeated the Cottagers home and away last season, but had found goals hard to come by in the early stages of the current campaign

programme.title: The Womens Football Show
programme.desc: Highlights of the weekends games in the Super League, including West Ham United v Chelsea, Liverpool v Manchester United and Arsenal v Aston Villa

programme.title: Juice
programme.desc: Guy doesnt want to see Jamma anymore, so when Jamma meets a magical stranger who offers to unburden him from his clownish ways to win Guy back, he decides to take the deal and is transformed. Guy has a photo shoot for his book cover, but doesnt want to look boring, so Isaac offers to style him in exchange for free therapy. Comedy, co-written by and starring Mawaan Rizwan, with Russell Tovey

programme.title: Juice
programme.desc: The new Jamma is reliable and consistent - he wants to respect Guys boundaries, but also needs Saifs address from Guy so he can try to reconnect with his father. Winnies dad is visiting for some quality father-daughter bonding, but shes not yet come out as straight to him and asks Isaac to play along. Comedy, starring Mawaan Rizwan, Russell Tovey and Emily Lloyd-Saini

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: The host returns with a roster of guests including Hollywood stars Dwayne Johnson and Emily Blunt, who are appearing together in true-life sports drama The Smashing Machine. Oscar-winning actor and writer Matthew McConaughey chats about his survival thriller The Lost Bus, and James Norton discusses his role in Steven Knights new period succession drama House of Guinness. Plus, singer-songwriter RAYE chats and performs her new single Where Is My Husband!

programme.title: Rapman: Back of the Bus
programme.desc: The rapper and director takes a tour around London with Micheal Ward, Stephen Odubola, Kadeem Ramsay, Junior Afolabi Salokun and Karla-Simone Spence, talking about male pride, growing up and what superpowers they would have

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Matt Smiths debut episode as the 11th Doctor. With the Tardis wrecked by the Time Lords regeneration, he crash-lands in a quiet English village, where he has 20 minutes to save the world and finds himself in need of a new companion. Perfectly placed for the job is Amy Pond, who joins him to help recapture an escaped alien prisoner. Starring Matt Smith and Karen Gillan, with guest appearances by Nina Wadia (EastEnders Zainab Masood) and Annette Crosbie (One Foot in the Grave)

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: The Time Lord takes Amy on her first adventure in the Tardis with a trip to the far future, visiting the Starship UK on its journey through space in search of a new home for the people of Britain. As she explores the vessel alone, she encounters the terrifying Smilers and learns the deadly truth about what goes on in the Voting Booth. Fantasy drama, with Matt Smith and Karen Gillan, guest starring Sophie Okonedo (Criminal Justice) and Terrence Hardiman (The Demon Headmaster)

programme.title: Ghosts US
programme.desc: A young couples dreams come true when they inherit a beautiful country house, only to find its falling apart and inhabited by many of the deceased previous residents. American version of the British comedy, starring Utkarsh Ambudkar, Rose McIver and Brandon Scott Jones

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey
programme.desc: Bryn is in his element as he awaits the arrival of the Essex boys, who are having a big night out in Cardiff and staying for a sleepover, but Smithy is concerned about seeing Nessa again after their last meeting. Meanwhile, Stacey tells Gavin about a worrying discovery, and Pam and Mick discuss their plans for a new conservatory

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey
programme.desc: Everyone gathers in Billericay as Pete and Dawn prepare to renew their wedding vows. Gavin feels uncomfortable about Gwen and Bryn knowing the details of his sex life, and Dave hears about the shocking events of the curry night. Meanwhile, Smithy goes beyond the call of friendship when he makes a staggering suggestion

programme.title: RuPauls Drag Race UK
programme.desc: The nervous energy is palpable as 12 brand new queens enter the werk room to meet their fellow competitors and judge supremo RuPaul for the very first time. In this race, nothing is predictable, and in their very first challenge, Ru has an extra-special challenge in store for the queens. In a Drag Race UK first, the queens display show-stopping looks as they attend the biggest night in fashion - the star-studded Brit Gala. Comedian and presenter Joel Dommett guests on the judging panel, alongside Michelle Visage and Alan Carr

programme.title: Two Pints of Lager and a Packet of Crisps
programme.desc: Jonny finds a new girlfriend, Gaz challenges David to a drinking contest, and a book has a profound effect on Louise. Sitcom, starring Ralf Little, Natalie Casey, Kathryn Drysdale and Sheridan Smith

programme.desc: Gaz tries to ease his guilt by doing something special for Donna, and Janet throws a party in honour of Louises graduation. Meanwhile, Jonny and Kate are more concerned with finding somewhere private. Will Mellor and Natalie Casey star

programme.title: Juice
programme.desc: Guy doesnt want to see Jamma anymore, so when Jamma meets a magical stranger who offers to unburden him from his clownish ways to win Guy back, he decides to take the deal and is transformed. Guy has a photo shoot for his book cover, but doesnt want to look boring, so Isaac offers to style him in exchange for free therapy. Comedy, co-written by and starring Mawaan Rizwan, with Russell Tovey

programme.title: Juice
programme.desc: The new Jamma is reliable and consistent - he wants to respect Guys boundaries, but also needs Saifs address from Guy so he can try to reconnect with his father. Winnies dad is visiting for some quality father-daughter bonding, but shes not yet come out as straight to him and asks Isaac to play along. Comedy, starring Mawaan Rizwan, Russell Tovey and Emily Lloyd-Saini

programme.desc: The Slaters are still in shock from last nights ordeal - but they remain suspicious when Zoe continues to evade the truth. Sharon arrives back in Walford and is surprised to see Zoe, Cindy causes tension between Lauren and Peter and an accident at the Albert leads to Mos firing

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Sharon offers Phil an olive branch after an awkward encounter, while Vicki and Zoe have an altogether more violent encounter in the Square. Howie gets a job delivering parcels, and Cindy is impressed by the initiative of Jasmine, a girl applying for a job at the Albert

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Ian tries to convince Sharon that Zoe is lying. Stacey tells Lily that Sean has invited them to live with him in Brazil. Penny orders Peter to tell Lauren the truth about his mystery woman. Jasmine makes a good impression with Cindy, but its clear Elaine isnt a fan

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Kat enlists Staceys help to plant a memorial for Zoes daughter in the Square gardens, and Zoe starts to thaw to her mum. Lily is over the moon when Stacey announces shes booked their flights to Brazil, but the moment is broken when Jean arrives. Peter is horrified to hear Lauren and Demi laughing at his expense. Oscar asks Jasmine out on a date by stealing her an outfit from the market

programme.title: Stranded on Honeymoon Island
programme.desc: The honeymooners are elated when boats bring their friends and family from the other side of the world, ready to give their opinions on their new partners And while double dates deliver some home truths, one couple decide to wave goodbye to their stranded dream for ever. Presented by Davina McCall

programme.title: Stranded on Honeymoon Island
programme.desc: A full moon party is thrown at the final Couples Cove. When events take a surprising turn, one pair is left questioning their future, before the honeymooners leave their beaches to spend time apart contemplating their relationships. Reality dating show, hosted by Davina McCall

programme.title: Stranded on Honeymoon Island
programme.sub-title: Stranded on Honeymoon Island: The Final Flare
programme.desc: Back in civilisation, the honeymooners are paid a surprise visit from presenter Davina McCall, who reveals they will all face one final flare-out. Will they choose to commit to each other in the real world, or will they leave their relationships behind on Honeymoon Island for ever?

programme.title: Road House
programme.desc: Former UFC fighter Elwood Dalton is determined to put his life of violence in the ring behind him but times are tough and he struggles to make ends meet - until bar owner Frankie makes him a proposition. She needs a head bouncer to protect her Florida Keys bar from a criminal and his rabble-rousing associates. It seems easy enough - until he comes up against a psychotic gun-for-hire determined to pummel him into submission. Remake of the 1989 Patrick Swayze thriller, starring Jake Gyllenhaal, Daniela Melchior and Conor McGregor

programme.desc: The writer and actor tours the UK in his campervan, exploring local legends, myths and folklore and gathering evidence in a bid to get to the truth. He begins by going in search of Black Shuck, the demon dog of East Anglia, attempting an overnight stakeout to capture it on film, with unexpected consequences

programme.title: BBC Comedy Short Films
programme.desc: Very average woman Spud cooks, cleans, serves and cares for her father. The only problem is she does it all rather badly - and half-heartedly. A woman who is never seen, unattractive and ignored, she does not feel bad about herself. However, when her father dies, she starts to realise she may have to come out from the shadow and be seen. Comedy drama, written by and starring Siobhan McSweeney

But Chep promises that this time he won’t.

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: Eyes On The Surprise/The Show Mush Go On/Mushpots Treasure/Mush-Mush The Predictor/Whos Eating Mushton/The Breathtaking...

But Lilit, who has never heard her sing before, wants to make Mushpie happy and organizes a concert for her to sing. / When Mushpot wishes he could roll back the seasons and relive being a Mushler, our friends get him to hang out doing cool Mushler stuff. / Mush-Mush can’t figure out why his sense foot keeps buzzing like crazy… until an earthquake shakes the forest. Mush-Mush is sure he predicted it! / Everyone in Mushton is finding that their precious wooden things are being munched and destroyed by someone or something. / If Mush-Mush had Bolly’s speed, he’d want everyone to see just how awesomely fast he was.

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: The Hero Trap/Bird Call/Let It Bee/The Staff Of Wisdom/The Snake Dance/Grasshopper Chep
programme.desc: The Mushlets love Mush-Mush’s heroic stories. But when they demand to see him actually do something heroic, Mush-Mush feels he can’t back out. / Chanterelle has built a whistle that can reproduce the most beautiful sound of the forest: the one of the Nightingale. / Wanting to rush off to climb Mush Mountain, Mush-Mush is in a hurry checking nectar level in flowers – a job that takes time and care. / Mush-Mush is amazed by the way Mushpot uses his staff of wisdom and how awesome it makes him look. / When Mush-Mush and Chep lose Lilit’s flying disc down a snake tunnel, he is confident he can get it back. / All the Mushables have fun zooming down a long mudslide except Chep, who just cant get up the courage to do it.

programme.title: Grizzy and the Lemmings
programme.sub-title: Polar Bear/Bear Spread/Cellular Bear/Jurassic Bear/Extreme Fitness/Domestic Robots/Mass Control/Bear Under Control/Popcorn Party
programme.desc: Nutty Hill is suffering from a stifling heat wave. Searching in vain for a bit of cool air, Grizzy suddenly has a brilliant idea. / Grizzy is frustrated when he discovers the pantry is empty! / Grizzys nap is interrupted by an annoying vibration. He sees the forest rangers cell phone on the couch. / Freed by the thawing ice a mysterious giant egg slides up to the front door of the log cabin. / In order to seduce the she-bear hes infatuated with Grizzy decides to take things in hand and slim down with the rangers bodybuilding equipment. / Grizzy gets pleasant back massages with the vacuum cleaner. / Grizzy discovers a gadget that controls various functions in the cabin. He will finally be able to rid of the Lemmings without even leaving the couch! / Grizzy turns the fridge into a safe. / The Lemmings have invented a new popcorn game which consists of throwing popcorn and catching it with their mouths.

programme.desc: When Lilit creates a ‘friends tree’ mapping out who everyone is best friends with in Mushton, she realizes Muddler has no friends at all. / Having rescued a Mushlet, Mush-Mush, Chep and Lilit becomes heroes in Mushton, and they’re loving it! / The Beacon Mushroom that guides the Mushables back to Mushton in the dark has gone out. / Every time Mush-Mush has tried to surprise his friend with a gift, Chep has always found out what it was. But Chep promises that this time he won’t. / Mushpie loves to sing. Only problem she is terrible at it! / When Mushpot wishes he could roll back the seasons and relive being a Mushler, our friends get him to hang out doing cool Mushler stuff

programme.title: Grizzy and the Lemmings
programme.desc: ...Tonic/Bear Itch/Thirst Quencher/Spider Lemmings/Random Bear/Lemming Interference/High Voltage Bear Attack => Grizzy wants to learn to dance the mambo to please the she-bear hes in love with, for she truly adores this rhythm. / After receiving a terrible blow over the head Grizzy is no longer the same: he thinks hes a rodent! He tries to get the gang to adopt him. / Grizzy battles with the Lemmings over the couch. / Grizzy discovers that the frenzied break dance the Lemmings are doing is actually due to the fleas they are infested with. / Grizzy is thirsty but the river bed has dried up. / The Lemmings have caught a little spider. Her sticky, elastic threads are absolutely perfect for bungee jumping. / Grizzy and the Lemmings fight over chocolate-spread jar lids, which they use as chips in a competition to win goodies. / Grizzys TV dinner is interrupted by unexplained static. / The Lemmings are having a rave party. When Grizzy throws their ghetto blaster into the river, he sparks a general power outage.

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: The Adventurers/Getting Truffy With It/Good Vibrations/Puffs Perfect Picnic/Run, Mushpie, Run
programme.desc: Because Mush-Mush, Chep and Lilit are always up to new adventures, Bolly has dubbed them The Adventurers. / Truff is happy. He has found a necklace that makes him even Truffier! Except he had no idea the necklace belongs to Starmush. / Lilit is under pressure. Truff, the most talented musician in Mushton, has invited her, Mush-Mush and Chep to form a band with him. / Because he has won the moss-ball game last year, Puff is in charge of organizing this Summer’s Picnic. Only Puff isn’t comfortable in that role. / Mush-Mush, Chep and Lilit notice that Mushpie seems in great shape lately. They want to feel as great as she does and try to discover her secret.

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: The Mysterious Seepod/A day with Starmush/Dare for more/Compost to Go
programme.desc: Chep has come across a new seedpod specimen. Mushpot warns him not to take it though. / Mush-Mush wants to be just like Starmush when he grows up, because he’s convinced that Starmush is the most awesome Mushable there is. / Mush-Mush, Chep and Lilit are playing dares and having a lot fun. All the Mushables are happy for them except Fung and Miff who keep mocking them. / When Mush-Mush, Chep and Lilit take their compost meals back to their home-tree to eat, they think they have made a great new discovery.

programme.title: Moley

programme.desc: When Moley is given the key to the city, he has such a great day he convinces Manny to let him repeat the whole day! / Moley vows to not eat worms for a few days in support of Dotty’s veganism and his worm craving temptations get out of control. / When Moley spends the day with a young mole named Cheese who wants to be just like him, Moley helps Cheese recognize his own talents and uniqueness. / Mishmosh builds a tunnel digger, upsetting some that it will replace moles’ need to dig themselves. Dotty accidently gets locked in the machine and it gets activated! / When Moletown experiences a heatwave, Moley and Dotty hope Mishmosh can invent something to cool things down.

programme.desc: Gumball and Darwin persuade Bobert to upgrade his operating system, then start to wish they hadnt. / Gumball is the star of his own comic, but struggles to match up to his heroic alter-ego. / Gumball tries to recapture the magic with Penny by organising a big romantic gesture. / Gumball and Darwin try to tear themselves away from the internet, but end up falling down the Elmore Stream-hole. / Gumball and Darwin try to find a single nice quality about their neighbour, Mrs Robinson. / When Alan ditches Gumball to do something more fun, Gumball is desperate to track him down and make him pay for his betrayal. / Mr Small feels that he hasnt inspired the children of Elmore Junior High, so Gumball and Darwin try to lift his spirits. / Gumball develops a strange stutter and it makes him accidentally offend Darwin. / Jamie has decided she needs a sweetheart and Darwin is the best candidate, unluckily for him.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.sub-title: The Parasite/The Love/The Scam/The Awkwardness/The Nest/The Points

He asks Gumball and Darwin to give him a definition for the word. / Gumball, Darwin and Carrie team up to convince their fellow students that the school is haunted. / Gumball is walking in the same direction as Hot Dog Guy, and with each step it becomes increasingly awkward. / Elmore residents are going missing, and the cause of these disappearances may be closer to home than Gumball and Darwin think. / Gumball and Darwin agree to do all of Tobiass chores, in exchange for good points!

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.sub-title: The Night/The Misunderstandings/The Roots/The Blame/The Slap/The Detective/The Fury/The Compilation
programme.desc: Ever wondered what the people of Elmore dream about? As night falls in Elmore the Moon takes us on a tour through the various dreams - and nightmares - of the i / Gumball is late to meet Penny at the mall, but a series of misunderstandings on the way only delay him further. / When Mom sees Darwin gazing longingly at a fish-tank she thinks their mammalian lifestyle isn’t fulfilling her adopted son and deep down he longs to connect wit / The Parent Teacher Association of Elmore Junior High bans video games, so the kids try and prove that games arent a bad influence. / Tobias follows every single high-five with a butt-slap so when Gumball doesn’t get one he feels insulted. He tries to get Tobias to slap his rear all day but it / Anais arrives in the bedroom to find a messy crime-scene and her Daisy doll missing. She realises Gumball and Darwin are the chief suspects. / A mysterious figure from Nicoles past shows up and challenges her to a fight, but the kids are surprised when she refuses. / A compilation of some of the funniest, most bizarre clips uploaded onto the internet by the people of Elmore.

The group are split over the relaxed atmosphere and the skill involved in the cooking. Night two sees Malcolm and Richard from The Bear and Blacksmith take the reins, as they aim to give their guests an ultra-local experience. Their main course comes straight from their farm next door and the vegetables are picked from the back garden, but one guest doesnt hold back on the critical detail when it comes to cooking off fat. programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: After a tension-filled final visit, payment day promises to be a feisty affair. Cleanliness standards have been questioned throughout, and the BandBers seem set to fight dirty when the debate starts

programme.title: Kirstie and Phils Love It or List It
programme.desc: In the desirable village of Radlett, Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer dive headfirst into a clash thats in danger of boiling over. Aneri, Nihar and their young daughter live in a three-bedroom end-of-terrace cottage. Aneri is desperate to leave behind the tight layout that prevents family gatherings, with its cubbyhole kitchen and lack of must-haves, such as a downstairs toilet. Nihar, however, is defiant that they will live there forever, refusing to let go of their beloved garden, and holds out hope that Kirstie can come up with a plan to resolve this two-year argument. With a £100,000 Love It budget, Kirstie faces a tall order and a planning headache that threatens to derail the whole build. Meanwhile, Phil is in his element finding dream properties with a £750,000 List It budget, but will Aneri play ball?

programme.title: Worst House on the Street

With just £20,000 to do all the work, siblings Stuart and Scarlette Douglas need all of their cost-saving tips and tricks to pull off this renovation

programme.title: Jamie: What to Eat This Week

Jamie gets creative with savoy cabbage in an Italian-inspired easy cheesy pasta dish with farfalle, bacon and pine nuts. He heroes some box-grown mushrooms in a stunning curry with crispy ginger-infused rice. He picks his home-grown sweetcorn and combines it with beans, breadcrumbs, herbs and feta to make a smoky sweetcorn burger. And finally, he cooks up a simple-yet-stunning tutti frutti pear tarte tatin thats perfect for a special occasion

programme.desc: Ben visits the wilds of central Portugal to meet Luke and Sarah, who gave up their careers to put down roots on a deserted sheep farm. As Ben helps them clear their land, forage acorns for the pet pigs and garden, he learns about the financial and physical troubles they have faced and their wider travelling adventures

programme.title: Ben Fogle: New Lives in the Wild
programme.desc: Ben travels to the forests of Chile to meet northern Brit Scott and his young family at their hand-built off-grid cabin in the woods. He learns about the challenges theyve faced in their two years of wild living, such as freak floods, forest fires and Scott losing a finger. Ben also sees how nature offers a form of therapy to his anxiety-ridden host

programme.title: Ben Fogle: New Lives in the Wild
programme.desc: Ben reconnects with his old British friend Paul Ferber and his family in Thailand. He learns why they left their Cambodian island home since he last saw them, where Paul was raising his own castaway tribe and defending sea-life from the illegal trawler trade. Now, they discuss how his tribe feel about their new jungle home, and whether their long-standing battle with pirates has continued

programme.title: Susan Calmans Grand Day Out
programme.desc: Susans adventures bring her to the county of Hampshire. In Portsmouth she explores HMS Victory, learning how Nelsons cunning tricks won out in the Battle of Trafalgar. She also visits the former home of Jane Austen in Chawton, which inspires her to have a go at Regency dancing, and finds out about a curious eating competition in the town of New Alresford

programme.title: Susan Calmans Grand Day Out
programme.desc: Susan explores the second largest county in England as she takes in the rural sights in and around the Lincolnshire Fens. The comedian stops by Isaac Newtons old family home of Woolsthorpe Manor House, explores Lincoln Cathedral, and tries soapbox racing

programme.title: Susan Calmans Grand Day Out
programme.desc: Susan e is on home soil exploring the beautiful Scottish Borders and the neighbouring county of Dumfries and Galloway. Just outside the town of Duns, Susan hears about Jim Clark, a local hero who became one of the greatest racing drivers of all time and Scotlands first Formula One Champion. She also heads to the base of the Leaderfoot Viaduct, where the northernmost amphitheatre of the Roman Empire once sat

programme.title: Michael Portillo in Andalucia
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores Huelva, starting in the town of Isla Cristina, where he meets restaurant owner Ramon, who is on the hunt for fish at the market. He stops off in the city to learn about Christopher Columbuss residence, before heading inland to see the mines of Rio Tinto and the town of Aracena. He ends his trip by learning about the regions most famous ham with brothers Domingo and Manolo

programme.title: Michael Portillo in Andalucia
programme.desc: Michael visits Andalucías Atlantic coast to explore Cádiz, Europes oldest inhabited city, arriving on board a 10-metre tall ship used by the Mexican navy to train its officer cadets. He learns about the history of the city from local guide Pilar and then heads inland to Jerez, taking part in a sherry tasting competition and learning about flamenco guitar. During his journey he experiences two major festivals - the finale of the annual Tall Ships race and the annual sherry grape harvest festival

programme.title: 5 News Weekend

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses: Secrets and Scandals
programme.desc: Behind-the-scenes stories of how Only Fools and Horses was made, and how the cast could have looked very different. The secrets behind the hilarious visual gags are revealed, and theres a look at the lost episodes of the show. Featuring interviews with Sue Holderness, who played Marlene, comedy actor and fan John Thomson, alongside cast and crew who made the series

programme.title: Secrets of the Royal Palaces
programme.desc: Behind-the-scenes tales of St Jamess Palace, which was built between 1531 and 1536 on the orders of Henry VIII and is the business centre of the royal family. There is a look at the history of Faberge eggs, of which the Royal Collection contains three, and Kate Williams explores more gruesome stories of palace history, including the horrific story of what happened to Catherine Parrs body, and how giving birth in a palace became a spectator sport

programme.title: Secrets of the Royal Palaces
programme.desc: Behind-the-scenes tales of Osborne House on the Isle of Wight, which was bought by Queen Victoria and Prince Albert in 1840 and was turned into their perfect renaissance hideaway. Kate Williams goes on a culinary adventure and tries traditional Tudor cuisine, including snails and pigs feet, while the horrors of the palaces bedding ceremony is revealed, where a royal bride is observed on her wedding night to make sure the marriage is consummated

programme.title: The Savoy: Londons First Luxury Hotel
programme.desc: A look at the 140-year history of the world-renowned hotel in the heart of London, how it has changed the hospitality industry and the famous faces that have dined and stayed there over the years

programme.title: William and the King: Like Father, Like Son
programme.desc: An exploration of the evolving bond between King Charles and the Prince of Wales, a father and son united not just by family, but by the future of the monarchy itself. This programme charts the journey of two men shaped by royal duty and personal loss, from shared passions for the environment and public service, to the relentless pressure of succession

programme.title: When... Goes Horribly Wrong

programme.title: Cruising with Susan Calman
programme.desc: The comedians summer cruise around the Adriatic continues with a visit to the high-rolling and fashionable Bay of Kotor in Montenegro. She continues with a trip to the beautiful old Croatian town of Dubrovnik with the cruise ships entertainment team, where she gets to visit a few of Game of Thrones most famous locations and relive some iconic scenes

programme.title: Holidaying with Jane McDonald: The Caribbean
programme.desc: Jane starts out on the trip of a lifetime as she island-hops solo around the Caribbean. She begins in Barbados, where she goes snorkelling with two fellow Brits from Yorkshire, and hires private tour guide Dawn Lisa to point out the magical sights that leave Jane in awe of the flora, fauna and culture of the island

programme.title: Holidaying with Jane McDonald: The Caribbean
programme.desc: Jane heads to St Lucia, taking a trip to the heart of the rainforest to get view of the flora and fauna from above the canopy, and going on a boat ride from the north to the south of the island en route to an outdoor hot tub heated by a volcano. Jane also meets Helen DeMacque-Crockett, aka Pepsi of Pepsi and Shirlie fame, who has St Lucian heritage and has moved to the island to run a sailboat charter business

programme.title: Cornwall with Fern Britton
programme.desc: Fern explores ancient regions with big histories in the form of West Wivelshire and Powdershire, which lie between the rivers of the Fowey and the Fal. Her first stop takes her to the historic Boconnoc Estate, before she heads to Fowey to learn more about much-loved author Daphne du Maurier

programme.title: Cornwall with Fern Britton
programme.desc: The last leg of the presenters road trip takes her to an industrious corner of Cornwall, the ancient Hundreds of Kerrier and Penwith. Fern discovers one of the best preserved ancient farming villages in the South West, which are among the oldest structures on the planet. Later, she visits the Lizard Peninsula, an area of outstanding natural beauty that as well as its unique landscape boasts a number of gems, including Cornish sea salt, Hevva Cake and Huer Huts. Finally, she meets some of the team from the RNLI at Lizard Point, the southernmost tip of mainland Britain

programme.title: Live: NFL Big Game Night
programme.desc: Pittsburgh Steelers v Minnesota Vikings (Kick-off 2.30pm). Osi Umenyiora and Nat Coombs are joined by reporter Ellie Evelyn for coverage of the week four match at Croke Park in Dublin. This is the first regular-season NFL match to take place in Ireland and features two teams who reached the play-offs last season, both falling at the wild card stage. It is the first meeting between the sides since December 2021, when the Vikings claimed a 36-28 home win

programme.title: Live: NFL Big Game Night
programme.desc: Detroit Lions v Cleveland Browns (Kick-off 6.00pm). Dermot OLeary and Sam Quek are joined by Osi Umenyiora for coverage of the week four match from Ford Field. The Lions are the only franchise operational for the entirety of the Super Bowl era to not appear in the showpiece match, but they recorded an excellent regular season record of 15-2 last time out before suffering a shock defeat at the hands of Washington Commanders in the Divisional Playoffs. In contrast, the Browns are looking to improve this time around after winning just three matches last term. Tonights coverage will also feature the game within a game quiz element, whenever the NFL game stops in the US

programme.title: Rich Holiday, Poor Holiday
programme.desc: Millionaire Cassy-Anne and her daughters Bug and Bunny ditch their usual luxury trips for a basic, no-frills one when they swap holidays with hard-up, nature-loving couple Sian and Joe. Never without their phones, Cassy-Anne and her girls have to cope without technology during their stay in shepherds hut in Dorset, while Sian and Joe have the run of a penthouse at an opulent five-star resort in Hvar, Croatia

programme.title: The Worlds Most Expensive Cruise Ships

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Proposal - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. Monica is left reeling by Richards proposal, which puts pressure on a nervous Chandler to bite the bullet and suggest she marry him instead. Comedy, guest starring Tom Selleck, with Courteney Cox and Matthew Perry

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: An ecstatic Monica plans an evening out to celebrate her engagement to Chandler, but ends up accusing Rachel of trying to steal her thunder by kissing Ross. American comedy, starring Courteney Cox, Jennifer Aniston and David Schwimmer

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Monica excitedly starts making preparations for her big day, only to discover her parents have spent all the wedding money on a beach house. Phoebe moves her massage parlour into Rosss apartment and Rachels choice of reading matter raises eyebrows

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Monica tries to re-create a secret recipe belonging to Phoebes grandmother, and Chandler accepts an invitation from future father-in-law Jack to play racquetball. Meanwhile, Rachel advises Joey on life on the ocean wave. Comedy, starring Jennifer Aniston and Courteney Cox

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: An attractive but unqualified man applies for a job as Rachels assistant, placing her in a quandary as she struggles to decide between hiring him or a more competent woman. Joeys TV show is cancelled after only one episode. American comedy, starring Jennifer Aniston and Eddie Cahill

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Engagement Picture
programme.desc: Rachel cajoles Joey into taking Tag on a boys night out, Ross and Phoebe date a couple in the middle of a divorce and Chandler has trouble striking the right pose for his engagement photograph with Monica. American comedy, starring Jennifer Aniston and Lisa Kudrow

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Nap Partners
programme.desc: Monica agonises over whether Rachel or Phoebe should be her maid of honour, and leaves the pair to sort it out between themselves. She also bumps into Chandlers ex-girlfriend Julie, and is horrified to discover he ended their relationship because she became fat

programme.title: Evolution
programme.desc: Two science teachers investigate a mysterious meteor and discover it is oozing a strange fluid containing millions of minuscule but rapidly evolving organisms - which start to turn into terrifying alien monsters with a taste for human flesh. Sci-fi comedy, starring David Duchovny, Orlando Jones, Julianne Moore, Seann William Scott, Dan Aykroyd and Ted Levine

programme.title: Friends

Guest starring Kristin Davis (Sex and the City)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with All the Candy

programme.sub-title: The One with the Holiday Armadillo

programme.title: Friends

programme.title: Friends

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Phoebe encounters a suicidal office worker during her first day as a telemarketer. Ross and Monica are upset to discover their parents intend to sell their childhood home, while Rachel and Chandler blame themselves for breaking Joeys favourite chair

programme.title: Bradley and Barney Walsh: Breaking Dad

programme.title: Dont Tell the Bride

programme.desc: On the first night in Brighton, party-loving Pete and Jasons home-made-from-scratch Italian menu impresses Debbie but not her partner Richard, although they both enjoy a rare night out together. Meanwhile, Chris and Barb, whove been married for almost 30 years, enjoy the night but dont rate Pete and Jason as any kind of rivals to their well-honed party-throwing skills. Novice hosts and accomplished bickerers Debbie and Richard are up next, but tension in the kitchen spills over to the table, leading to some cold food and awkward chat. Finally, Chris and Barb rely on their years of hosting experience and teamwork skills to deliver a tried-and-tested menu, and throw in a little something extra

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Bettina and her husband Giovanni kick off the contest in West Sussex with an Italian menu. However, married couples Linda and Dave, and Chris and Ewelina, are unimpressed with Bettinas lack of home cooking. On day two, school inspectors Dave and Linda offer French fine dining. Inspired by their love of the countryside, they plan to use as much home-grown produce from their garden as possible. After Dave and Lindas comments on the first night, their guests are expecting everything to be home-made, leading to a dramatic revelation at dessert. Finally, Polish-born Ewelina and her husband Chris serve up a home-made menu. Ewelina takes control in the kitchen, while funnyman Chris does his best to distract her

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Married couple Rupert and Jo host first in Bournemouth, with a night based on their favourite travel destinations. Then on night three, Darren takes the lead in the kitchen, while Jemma is the glamorous assistant who doesnt seem to actually assist

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me

programme.desc: Two more pairs of singles take the leap of faith, and while theres an instant spark for one couple, another brides horseback arrival sends her new in-laws reeling

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK
programme.desc: Two more bold singles take the leap of faith, but a brides pursuit for perfection could jeopardise her chances of finding love. Also, four more newly-weds jet off on glamorous honeymoon escapes, where one grooms negative nature threatens to ruin any chance of romance

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Theres a death in Springfield, while Krustys confidence takes a beating after he appears on a TV comedy roast with Sarah Silverman and Jeff Ross, prompting him to retire from the business. Lisa becomes worried for Homers safety, so sets out to prevent him getting hurt

programme.title: Lego Masters Australia
programme.desc: The final four teams battle it out over ten hours as they build a serene scene, using a specified colour palette, on a floating lily pad, to earn a place in the grand finale. The builds must balance and float perfectly on the lily pad in the pond, and the winners of the previous Batman challenge choose the colours for all of the teams

programme.title: The Greatest Showman
programme.desc: After losing his job as a shipping clerk, PT Barnum creates and develops his circus in New York in the mid-1800s with the help of playwright Phillip Carlyle and an adopted family of entertainers shunned by society. Musical drama, starring Hugh Jackman, Zac Efron, Michelle Williams, Rebecca Ferguson and Zendaya

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK
programme.desc: Reality experiment in which experts select compatible couples from a long list of applicants, then invite them to marry - despite them never having met before

programme.title: MAFS UK: Its Official!
programme.sub-title: MAFS UK: Its Official! With Lucinda Light
programme.desc: Lucinda Light is joined by radio and TV presenter Yinka Bokinni to discuss all the goings-on. Also, hearing from one newly-wed and finding out what its really like getting married to a stranger

programme.title: Virgin Island
programme.desc: The documentary following 12 adult virgins on a course in intimacy at a luxury Mediterranean retreat. The group members are introduced to touch therapy, including massage and an animal game that aims to ignite their sexual impulses. Ben faces rejection when he develops feelings for a coursemate, Taylor struggles with her feelings towards men and women and Jason tries to overcome his fear of hugging

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on what they watched during a week in March 2021, including Line of Duty, Ant and Decs Saturday Night Takeaway, This Is My House, The Proof Is Out There, Formula 1: Drive to Survive, Countdown, This Morning, and vaccines on the News

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK
programme.desc: Reality experiment in which experts select compatible couples from a long list of applicants, then invite them to marry - despite them never having met before

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Raj is upset after Lucy runs away in the middle of their date, leaving the gang to cheer him up. However, when Howard bumps into her, she admits she is incredibly shy. Meanwhile, Sheldon asks Penny to help with a new episode of Fun with Flags, and because he is impressed by her acting ability, the friends go to see her in a performance of A Streetcar Named Desire

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: While the girls go to Disneyland and get made up as princesses, the guys have to promote science as a career option for women at Howards old middle school. Meanwhile, Raj and Lucy have their first date in a library, where instead of speaking to each other they send text messages

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Bernadette and Howard host a dinner party, but as it falls on Sheldons Thai food night, he opts to bring his own dinner. As punishment for his lack of manners, the gang decides he should organise Wolowitzs cluttered wardrobe, but he discovers an unopened letter from Howards father, who hasnt made contact in years

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The guys compete for a tenured professor position at the university, leading them to try to win over the committee in charge of appointing a new staff member, and arguing about who deserves the spot the most. However, the panel includes Mrs Davis from Human Resources, whom Sheldon has crossed paths with before. Guest starring Regina King

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to New Jerseys Spanish Pavillion, which is run by two warring brothers whose staff spend more time using their mobile phones than working. The chef plans to turn the eaterys fortunes around, and starts by giving the dining room and menu a modern makeover

programme.title: Hollyoaks Omnibus
programme.desc: Darrens world turns upside down, while Diane is forced to face her true feelings for Tony. Peri finds comfort in Tom as sparks fly during their date. Sienna decides to do whatever it takes to escape, and a shocking theory is shared about Robbies whereabouts. Also, Tonys case suffers a blow, and Clare celebrates when Donny delivers some news

programme.title: Think Like a Dog
programme.desc: A 12-year-old tech prodigys science experiment goes awry and he forges a telepathic connection with his dog. The duo join forces and use their unique perspectives on life to overcome complications of family and school. Family comedy drama, starring Josh Duhamel, Megan Fox and Gabriel Bateman

programme.title: The Muppets Take Manhattan
programme.desc: Kermit, Miss Piggy, Fozzie Bear and company try to take Broadway by storm with their college show, setting the stage for a host of misadventures as they yearn for stardom in the Big Apple and set out to raise the money to finance their production. Comedy, performed by Jim Henson and Frank Oz, with appearances by Liza Minnelli, Art Carney, Dabney Coleman, Gregory Hines, Joan Rivers, Brooke Shields, Linda Lavin and Elliott Gould

programme.title: Dunston Checks In
programme.desc: A gentleman jewel thiefs pet orang-utan runs amok in a swanky hotel, causing endless problems for the put-upon manager who has enough on his plate trying to ensure the establishment successfully attains a six-star rating. Family comedy, starring Jason Alexander, Rupert Everett, Faye Dunaway, Eric Lloyd and Paul Reubens

programme.title: Time Bandits
programme.desc: A bemused schoolboy is escorted on a bizarre journey through time by a group of larcenous dwarfs. His adventures lead him to encounters with various characters from history - but none of them are quite what he had imagined. Terry Gilliams fantasy comedy, starring Craig Warnock, David Rappaport, John Cleese, Michael Palin, Sean Connery, Ian Holm, Ralph Richardson and David Warner

programme.title: Cowboys and Aliens
programme.desc: A Wild-West town dominated by a cattle baron comes under attack by invaders from another world. It falls to a mysterious stranger with no memory to unite the townsfolk, a gang of outlaws and an Apache tribe, in a bid to fight back against the aliens, and learn the truth about his own past. Sci-fi Western, with Daniel Craig, Harrison Ford, Olivia Wilde and Sam Rockwell

programme.title: Plane
programme.desc: On New Years Eve, Trailblazer Air pilot Captain Brodie Torrance takes flight with handcuffed prisoner Louis Gaspare on board. A direct lightning strike forces Torrance and co-pilot Dele to emergency land on a remote island under the control of militia leader Junmar. Action thriller, starring Gerard Butler and Mike Colter

programme.title: The Predator
programme.desc: When a young boy accidentally signals the galaxys most lethal hunters who set course for Earth, an eclectic band of former soldiers and a scientist attempt to prevent the end of the human race. Director Shane Blacks fourth entry in the sci-fi thriller saga, starring Boyd Holbrook, Trevante Rhodes, Jacob Tremblay, Keegan-Michael Key and Olivia Munn

programme.title: Unsane
programme.desc: A young woman is involuntarily committed to a psychiatric institute, where she is confronted by her greatest fear - but is it real or part of her delusion? Steven Soderberghs horror, shot entirely on an iPhone, starring Claire Foy, Joshua Leonard and Jay Pharoah

programme.title: Secret Headquarters
programme.desc: Fourteen-year-old Charlie Kincaid yearns for a deeper connection to his father Jack, who frequently disappears at short notice for work. When an IT conference interrupts Charlies birthday, the teenager invites friends to a party at his fathers house, and they stumble upon a subterranean, gizmo-laden lair. Comedy adventure, starring Owen Wilson, Walker Scobell and Michael Pena

programme.title: Film4 Interview Specials
programme.desc: Stars Tom Cruise, Rebecca Ferguson, Henry Cavill, Simon Pegg, Vanessa Kirby and director Christopher McQuarrie talk about making the sixth instalment in the franchise

programme.title: Miracle on 34th Street
programme.desc: A woman raises her six-year-old daughter to believe that Santa Claus does not exist, but they both have a change of heart after meeting a department store Father Christmas who claims to be the man himself. When the kindly fellow is accused of being a charlatan, his new friends engage a lawyer to prove his true identity. Remake of the 1947 family drama, with Richard Attenborough, Elizabeth Perkins, Mara Wilson and Dylan McDermott

programme.title: Midway
programme.desc: The story of the Battle of Midway, a clash between the American fleet and the Imperial Japanese Navy, which marked a pivotal turning point in the Pacific Theatre during the Second World War. When US intelligence intercepts messages detailing a Japanese attack on an unnamed location, it becomes a race against time to both figure out where will be hit next and how to prepare for an impending battle. Roland Emmerichs drama, starring Ed Skrein, Patrick Wilson, Woody Harrelson and Luke Evans

programme.title: Hunter Killer
programme.desc: Unconventional submarine skipper Joe Glass is sent to investigate the torpedoing of US and Russian vessels. He winds up trying to rescue the Russian president, who has been kidnapped by a rogue general. Action thriller, starring Gerard Butler, Gary Oldman and Common

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Fallout
programme.desc: Ethan Hunt and the IMF team join forces with CIA assassin August Walker to prevent a disaster caused by mysterious arms dealer John Lark and a group of terrorists known as the Apostles. However, Hunt and his colleagues are soon pushed to their limits thanks to a face from their past. Writer/director Christopher McQuarries sixth entry in the action thriller saga, starring Tom Cruise, Henry Cavill, Ving Rhames, Simon Pegg and Rebecca Ferguson

programme.title: The Spy Who Dumped Me
programme.desc: Two friends are thrust into the middle of an international conspiracy when one of them discovers the ex-boyfriend who broke up with her by text message is really a CIA agent on the run from a team of assassins. The revelation sends them on a death-defying journey across Europe with the fate of the world at stake. Comedy, starring Mila Kunis, Kate McKinnon, Sam Heughan and Gillian Anderson

programme.title: Locke
programme.desc: A devoted family man preparing to face the biggest challenge of his career receives a mysterious phone call that leads him to make a fateful decision. However, this act sets in motion a series of events that threaten to destroy his entire life over the course of a single car journey. Thriller, starring Tom Hardy, with the voices of Olivia Colman and Andrew Scott

programme.sub-title: Only the Bad Come to Sonora
programme.desc: Manolito is robbed while trying to return to the ranch with Montoyas stallion. Western drama, starring Leif Erickson and Cameron Mitchell

programme.title: The High Chaparral
programme.desc: Big John proposes the ranchers work together to drive their herds to Wichita instead of Texas to increase their profit. Western drama, starring Leif Erickson

programme.title: Five Guns West
programme.desc: Five convicted outlaws, all facing the gallows, are offered a last minute reprieve by the Confederacy - provided they undertake a dangerous mission. An intelligence agent has switched sides to support the North, and must be captured alive, along with the shipment of gold hes carrying. But the temptation to run off with the loot is hard to resist. Western, starring John Lund, Dorothy Malone, Touch Connors and Paul Birch

programme.title: Rawhide
programme.desc: Outlaws hold staff and a passenger and her baby hostage at a remote stagecoach station while awaiting the arrival of a shipment of $100,000 in gold bullion. The nervous captives try to stay calm, but the tension between the gang leader and a jumpy henchman grows fraught, ending in a frantic shoot-out - with the infant in the thick of the fray. Western, starring Tyrone Power, Susan Hayward and Jack Elam

programme.title: Valdez Is Coming
programme.desc: Mexican lawman Valdez is double-crossed and left for dead by a ruthless cattle baron, but returns to seek vengeance on his enemy. However, the rancher has the law on his side, so Valdez metes out his own form of justice by kidnapping his wife. Western adapted from an Elmore Leonard novel, starring Burt Lancaster, Susan Clark, Jon Cypher and Barton Heyman

programme.desc: A wealthy Texan hires four mercenaries to rescue his wife, who has been abducted and taken to Mexico by a bandit gang. Western adventure, with Burt Lancaster, Lee Marvin, Robert Ryan, Woody Strode, Jack Palance and Claudia Cardinale

Adventure, starring John Wayne, John Agar, Adele Mara and Forrest Tucker

programme.title: The Guns of Fort Petticoat
programme.desc: A lieutenant deserts after his commanding officer launches an unprovoked attack on a Comanche village during the Civil War. Realising that there are no soldiers in his home town to protect it from reprisals, he returns to train the local women to defend themselves. Western, starring Audie Murphy, Kathryn Grant, Hope Emerson and Jeff Donnell

programme.title: The Wild and the Innocent
programme.desc: A naive beaver trapper finds himself with an unwanted travelling companion in the shape of a woman fleeing her family. They leave their mountain home for a nearby town, but find their first taste of city living harder to cope with than expected, especially when they fall foul of a crooked sheriff. Comedy Western, starring Audie Murphy and Sandra Dee

programme.title: Winchester 73
programme.desc: A gunslinger tracks down his fathers killer, but is unable to exact his revenge because the sheriff of the town makes a point of confiscating all firearms. Instead he challenges him to compete in a shooting competition to win a superb rifle, but when the murderer loses, he steals the coveted prize. Western, starring James Stewart, Shelley Winters, Dan Duryea and Stephen McNally

programme.title: Reap the Wild Wind
programme.desc: The owner of a 19th-century salvage company falls in love with a captain she rescues from a shipwreck, and helps him prove in court that the vessels sinking was not his fault. However, the lawyer hired to plead the case also falls for the salvager, and the rivalry drives the captain into an alliance with a ruthless pirate. Romantic adventure, starring John Wayne and Paulette Goddard

programme.title: Maximum Conviction
programme.desc: Two special forces agents are given the task of transporting a pair of female convicts to prison, only to come under attack by a mercenary force sent to kill them. When they discover the true identity of the women in their charge, they realise the situation is even more dangerous than it seems. Action adventure, starring Steven Seagal and Steve Austin

The couple settle into their new life, but the mysterious woman makes her presence felt, subjecting them to a campaign of hatred in an attempt to force them out. Tragedy soon strikes, but as luck would have it Miss Marple is staying nearby with her recently widowed old friend Mrs Phillpot. However, if the spinster sleuth is to solve the puzzle, she must put her own life in grave danger. Murder mystery, starring Julia McKenzie, with Wendy Craig, Glynis Barber, Hugh Dennis, Tamzin Outhwaite, Tom Hughes, Joanna Vanderham, Aneurin Barnard, William Hope and Janet Henfrey

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: A woman is murdered in a hedgerow but her son survives the attack, only to fall beneath the ice of a frozen pond as he makes his escape. DCI Vera Stanhope wades in and drags him out, and against all the odds he pulls through. As the investigation into the mothers killing unfolds, Vera finds a kindred spirit in the boy and comes to realise the key to solving the case lies deep in his memory. Detective drama, starring Brenda Blethyn, with Kerry Fox and Kieran OBrien

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The annual Scarecrow Festival takes a grisly turn as bodies begin appearing on poles displayed alongside their straw creations. Barnaby and Winters investigation reveals rivalries that run deep and shows people will do just about anything to win. Neil Dudgeon stars

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective investigates the death of a pensioner found stabbed on a train at the height of rush hour. The case has a huge impact on Joes home life when his daughter is named as a key witness, and he struggles to maintain a professional distance. The trail leads the team to a quiet Northumberland coastal town where clues appear to lead to one particular street - but why are the residents so reluctant to talk? Starring Brenda Blethyn, with David Leon, Sonya Cassidy, Jon Morrison and Eva Birthistle

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective is called in when David Kenworthy, the son of a prominent local family, is found murdered on the beach at Whitley Bay. A witness spotted arcade owner Larry Crowe arguing with David on the night of the killing, and a search of the suspects property uncovers a bloodied baseball bat. However, Larry has a cast-iron alibi and its clear he wasnt the only person the victim met that night. A second death then leaves Vera facing mounting pressure to crack the case, and struggling to answer the question of why David was drawn to the seafront on the evening of his fathers retirement. Brenda Blethyn stars in the murder mystery, with David Leon as her trusty sidekick Joe

programme.title: Sonic Prime
programme.desc: The wise-cracking blue hedgehog, made famous by a series of popular video games on Sega consoles, continues his computer-animated adventures through the Shatterverse. At the end of the first series, the eponymous spiny mammal (voiced by Deven Mack) learnt from black hedgehog Shadow (Ian Hanlin) that the original version of Green Hill no longer exists. Sonic is trapped in a multiverse of mayhem with different iterations of his friends Amy Rose (Shannon Chan-Kent), Knuckles (Adam Nurada), Rouge (Kazumi Evans) and Tails (Ashleigh Ball). programme.desc: The heroes in a half shell come to terms with their new roles as saviours of New York City in an animated series set shortly after the events chronicled in the film Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Mutant Mayhem. Donatello (voiced by Micah Abbey), Leonardo (Nicolas Cantu), Michelangelo (Shamon Brown Jr) and Raphael (Brady Noon) experience the usual growing pains of teenagers while contending with the media spotlight. Building on their friendship with aspiring reporter April ONeil (Ayo Edebiri), the reptilian quartet face brilliant inventor Bishop (Alanna Ubach), who believes mutants are the greatest danger facing humankind and must be eliminated. Meanwhile, pampered rich kid Rod (Pete Davison) yearns to be a mutant and leverages his wealth and connections to achieve a dangerous dream

programme.title: Sonic Prime
programme.desc: The wise-cracking blue hedgehog, made famous by a series of popular video games on Sega consoles, continues his computer-animated adventures through the Shatterverse. At the end of the first series, the eponymous spiny mammal (voiced by Deven Mack) learnt from black hedgehog Shadow (Ian Hanlin) that the original version of Green Hill no longer exists. Sonic is trapped in a multiverse of mayhem with different iterations of his friends Amy Rose (Shannon Chan-Kent), Knuckles (Adam Nurada), Rouge (Kazumi Evans) and Tails (Ashleigh Ball). Sonic and Shadow must put aside their differences and work together to repair the temporal damage and outwit diabolical scientist Dr Eggman (Brian Drummond)

Matt has never fully understood what Margot experienced as a young woman in Berlin in the lead up to the Second World War - or what became of the extended family she left behind. Matts poignant journey takes him to Berlin, and then to Amsterdam where he discovers an extraordinary connection to Anne Frank, as well as the fate of his many family members who had fled to Holland, which was later was invaded by the Germans

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Singer-songwriter KT Tunstall always knew she was adopted and in 1998 was reunited with her birth mother, who told her that her father never wanted to give her up - a message that has inspired her to find out what happened to him. programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell follow Kathleen Fraser Jacksons search for her mother, with the 62-year-old having been trying to track down the woman who gave her up for adoption for more than 40 years. programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
programme.desc: Monica Galetti and Rob Rinder arrive at Borgo Egnazia in Puglia, which is a hotel like no other. Newly constructed to look like a 200-year-old village, it strives to capture the heart of the area through its local food and immersive design. But how genuine is it really? Rob and Monica work alongside the staff to find out

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The weeks seven remaining contenders face the Market Challenge - where they are tasked with inventing a dish on the spot for judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace from a market full of ingredients - which on this occasion include Bavette steak, plaice and oysters. Later, as one contestant heads home, food critic William asks those remaining to cook a dish inspired by a favourite ready-bought food item - sweet or savoury. At the end of this episode only four contestants can go through to the quarter-final

programme.title: The Records Show
programme.desc: Katie Hannon rides in Irelands rarest car, and the small seaside village of Curracloe becomes a war zone. Also, a Rathmines shopkeeper becomes embroiled in the Dublin Castle scandal, and theres the curious case of rugby and the mugwumps

programme.title: Keys to My Life
programme.desc: Singer Niamh Kavanagh takes a journey from her childhood home in Glasnevin and revisits the house where she was living when she won Eurovision singing In Your Eyes back in 1993

programme.title: Cheap Irish Homes
programme.desc: Maggie Molloy searches for properties with Peter Cruise, a 65-year-old carpenter, from Dublin. Peter is looking to move out of the city and into a cottage with space for a workshop

programme.title: Topaz
programme.desc: A CIA operative enlists the help of his friend, a French secret agent, in locating the source responsible for leaking classified Nato information to Moscow. However, the investigation leads to a Soviet espionage ring operating within the French government and a plot connected to a Cuban rebellion. Alfred Hitchcocks spy thriller, starring John Forsythe, Frederick Stafford, Dany Robin and Roscoe Lee Browne

programme.title: Minions: The Rise of Gru
programme.desc: Young Gru attends an interview to join a diabolical dream team christened the Vicious 6, but Belle Bottom, Jean-Clawed, Nun-chuck, Svengeance and Stronghold cruelly dismiss the boy. In retaliation for the ageist snub, the resourceful tyke steals an ancient amulet that can harness the power of the 12 creatures of the Chinese zodiac. Animated comedy prequel, featuring the voices of Steve Carell, Alan Arkin, Taraji P Henson and Jean-Claude Van Damme

programme.title: Killinaskully
programme.desc: Dan is forced into a head-to-head battle of the L plates with Goretti after making a remark about women drivers. programme.desc: Theres a new fake Billy Murphy in town, and he steals Conors most prized possession - the engraved lighter given to him by his best friend Jock. Comedy, starring Alex Murphy and Chris Walley

programme.title: The Tommy Tiernan Show
programme.desc: Improvised chat show in which neither the presenter nor the viewers are told the identity of the guests in advance. However, as police and family members conduct their investigations, suspicion falls rather too close to home. Drama, directed by Clint Eastwood and featuring Oscar-winning performances from Sean Penn and Tim Robbins. With Kevin Bacon, Laura Linney and Laurence Fishburne

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: When Will is involved in a motorcycling accident and the evidence suggests that he was driving recklessly, he is accused of manslaughter, but Geordie cant believe Will is guilty. programme.title: 10 Things to Know About
programme.desc: Kathriona Devereux and Jonathan McCrea explore ways to decarbonise heating, from public buildings to private homes. They look at how district heating systems can be combined with heat pump technology to reduce Irelands reliance on fossil fuels and reduce costs. They also meet researchers who discuss the geology behind geothermal energy, highlight projects investigating potential sources around Ireland - including a few surprising locations that have been using geothermal for decades - and discuss how heat from the Earth could form a crucial part of Irelands supply-and-demand heating network

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Jodie looks back on her days as a student midwife five years previously, when her mother chose to stop her chemotherapy treatment. She receives word that her mothers health has deteriorated just as she is preparing to deliver a baby, and is faced with an impossible choice between her family and the needs of her patient

programme.title: RTÉ News: One OClock and Weather
Nevens Ulster Food Tour
programme.desc: Neven Maguire visits Glenarm Castle in Ballymena where he wanders around the gardens with estate manager Adrian Morrow, and also sees their famous shorthorn beef cows. He also takes a trip to Morellis ice cream shop in Portrush, where he samples some of their award winning flavours. Nevens own recipe is vanilla and hazelnut no-churn ice cream with poached pears and chocolate sauce

programme.title: Seisiún
